title: Costa Group crunched in ASX return
text:
Costa Group shares were crunched after the ailing fruit and vegetable grower returned to the ASX on Wednesday after a lengthy trading halt.

Shares in the company plunged to a three-year low of $2.38 in early trading on Wednesday before recovering slightly by late morning to be 25 per cent down at $2.58.

This compared with the $3.46 it last traded at before entering a halt on October 21. The shares were trading at $7.10 in December, 2018.

Costa Group on Monday announced a hefty profit downgrade, its fourth of the year, and an underwritten $176 million one-for-four entitlement issue at a steep discount of $2.20 per share.

Low prices for mushrooms in an oversupplied market have hit Costa Group. Rohan Thomson

The company has been suffering from an extended industry-wide glut of mushrooms and blueberries, and also from the impact of the drought.
description: The battling fruit and vegetable grower's shares briefly sunk towards a three-year low when it returned from a trading halt.
